headings: The entire world has become computerized and connected.
What Can You Do With a Cybersecurity Degree?
Why Earn My Cybersecurity Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: How would you like to be at the forefront of protecting our critical systems from hackers and cyber terrorists? With a cybersecurity bachelor’s degree, you could join the next generation of professionals at the cutting edge of our local, regional and national security.

Our wide-ranging program is one of the newest cybersecurity degrees in Texas. It covers everything from network security, operating system security and database security - to cloud security, software security, cryptography and digital forensics. You can also earn an extra certificate credential within your degree plan and gain practical experience through paid internships and part-time jobs on campus.

Our dedicated faculty are computer science and cybersecurity professionals who stay up to date with the latest advances in technology and cyber threats. They are also available to work with you on high-level research projects. With their guidance and collaboration, you’ll become a cybersecurity professional with up-to-date knowledge and industry-aligned, hands-on experience.
Cybersecurity & Computer Science Faculty and Staff
ASU Distinguished ScholarshipsOur premier scholarships are awarded based on your academic achievement, and you don’t even have to apply. You are automatically considered once you are admitted to ASU.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.
Blue and Gold GuaranteeIf you have financial need, you may qualify forfree tuitionto attend Angelo State.

With a cybersecurity undergraduate degree, you can start your career as soon as you graduate. The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that career opportunities for information security analysts and other cybersecurity professionals are expected to increase by about 35% over the next decade, with average salaries of over $100,000.
Plus, industry reports indicate there are about three million cybersecurity positions currently open across the U.S.

We have partnered with the Texas Department of Information Resources (DIR) to operate the first Regional Security Operations Center (RSOC) in the state. Paid internships are available to work with RSOC staff providing cybersecurity support to local government agencies. Interns get front-line experience battling cyberthreats and improving the safety of the community.

You could intern in the Texas DIR Data Center on campus and/or our IT Department, and off-campus internships are also available. You can also work part time in our computer labs or IT Department, and you can provide cybersecurity guidance and support to students of all ages and the public through programs in our Kay Bailey Hutchison Center for Cyber Intelligence, Innovation and Security Studies.

You can earn a certificate in Cybersecurity Technologies without taking extra classes. Just complete a specific four-course block within your degree plan. This additional credential can give you an edge when applying for a job or for graduate school.

Take your education to the next level in theASU Honors Program. Through special courses, cultural events, research and community engagement, we’ll help you transform your intellectual and personal talents into marketable skills for your future. You’ll also have the opportunity to participate in prestigious internships, fellowships and other programs to reach your full potential.

OurFreshman Collegeis a one-stop resource for programs and services that help you transition into college life, improve your communication skills, and engage in active learning. You can also get academic help in theMath LabandWriting Center, receive peer mentoring and tutoring throughSupplemental Instruction, or set up onlinetutoringsessions.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.
